required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: In-market Utilisation of Liraglutide Used for Weight Management in Europe
clinical_study.official_title: In-market Utilisation of Liraglutide Used for Weight Management in Europe: a Retrospective Medical Record Review Study.

brief_summary.textblock: This study is conducted in Europe. The aim of this study is to investigate usage of liraglutide for weight management in clinical practice.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with BMI above or equal to 30 kg/m^2
primary_outcome.time_frame: Less than 6 months before date of first prescription

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with BMI above or equal to 27kg/m^2 and below 30 kg/m^2 and 1 or more comorbidity
primary_outcome.time_frame: Less than 6 months before date of first prescription
primary_outcome.description: Comorbidities defined as dysglycaemia, hypertension, dyslipidaemia, and/or obstructive sleep apnoe

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with above or equal to 27 kg/m^2 and below 30 kg/m^2 and no comorbidities
primary_outcome.time_frame: Less than 6 months before date of first prescription
primary_outcome.description: Comorbidities defined as dysglycaemia, hypertension, dyslipidaemia, and/or obstructive sleep apnoe

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with BMI below 27 kg/m^2
primary_outcome.time_frame: Less than 6 months before date of first prescription

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with BMI not measured
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 6 months before date of the first prescription

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with liraglutide 1.2 or 1.8 mg prescriptions with dose information of 3.0 mg per day
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first prescription until 24 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with liraglutide 1.2 or 1.8 mg prescriptions and indication of weight management
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first prescription until 24 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with liraglutide 3.0 mg prescriptions who have reached a dose of 3.0 mg
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 4-12 weeks from date of first prescription
secondary_outcome.description: While adhering to the dose escalation according to label

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with liraglutide 3.0 mg prescriptions and other GLP-1 receptor agonists prescribed during continued treatment with liraglutide 3.0 mg
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first prescription until 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Continued treatment is defined as no gaps between prescriptions of more than 90 days, identified by examining repeat prescription dates

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with continued treatment with liraglutide 3.0 mg
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first prescription until 0-6 weeks; 7-12 weeks; 13-18 weeks; 19-24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Continued treatment defined as no gaps between prescriptions of more than 90 days, identified by examining repeat prescription dates

intervention.description: Patients will be treated according to routine clinical practice at the discretion of the treating physician. The study will gather data over the course of routine treatment for liraglutide 3.0 mg and liraglutide 1.2 mg/1.8 mg treated patients

study_pop.textblock: This is a descriptive study designed to examine in-market utilisation of liraglutide; thus there will be no hypothesis testing and a power calculation is not applicable. 100 patients will be enrolled for the pilot study (50 in each country, ) and additionally 300 patients will be enrolled for the full study (150 in each country)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Initiation of liraglutide 3.0 mg / liraglutide 1.2 mg/1.8 mg (initiation is defined as no prescription of the same brand within the previous 12 months)
- Informed consent obtained before any study-related activities. Study-related activities are any procedures that are carried out as part of the study, including activities to determine suitability of the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients or physicians who previously participated in interventional studies for liraglutide 3.0 mg / liraglutide 1.2 mg/1.8 mg will not be eligible to participate in the study
- For the full study, sites and patients included in the pilot will be excluded
